00045 #ifndef CPCLIB_HEADER
00046 #define CPCLIB_HEADER
00047 
00048 // check the operating system used
00049 #ifdef _WIN32
00050 
00051         // on Windows OS we use a byte alignment of 1
00052   #pragma pack(push, 1)
00053   
00054   // set the calling conventions for the library function calls
00055         #define CALL_CONV __stdcall
00056   
00057 #else
00058 
00059         // Linux does not use this calling convention
00060   #define CALL_CONV
00061   
00062         // this macro is needed to obtain the devices file descriptor
00063         #define CPC_GetFdByHandle(h)   ((CPC_GetInitParamsPtr((h)))->chanparams.fd)
00064 
00065   #ifndef CAN_MAX_DEVICE
00066         #ifdef PLATFORM_GSMTEST
00067         #define  CAN_MAX_DEVICE    6
00068           #elif PLATFORM_ETHERCAN
00069           #define  CAN_MAX_DEVICE    1
00070           #elif PLATFORM_INT1000
00071           #define  CAN_MAX_DEVICE    1
00072           #else // PLATFORM_UNSPECIFIED
00073           #define  CAN_MAX_DEVICE    1
00074           #endif
00075         #endif
00076 
00077         extern unsigned int CPCLIBverbose;
00078 
00079 #endif
00080

00087 char*   CALL_CONV CPC_GetLibVersion        (void);
00088

00091 int   CALL_CONV CPC_CloseChannel      (int handle);

00093 int       CALL_CONV CPC_CANExit                   (int handle, unsigned char confirm);
